text:
Hey apologies for the delayed response! Been very busy with work recently! 

Oh right, well I think most uni courses will involve seminars or lectures/lessons as that's just part of education really! But as long as it's not all that? But really it sounds like you want to be able to start working/ apprenticeship kind of thing if that's how you learn best? 

Okay well that sounds like like it should be interesting! Sounds like a good choice for you then! 

Ah good question! <@U5XTUA3HT>/curiosity. So basically as a recruitment consultant, it is my job to find companies people to work for them. They give me a specification of their ideal candidate, and i go out and find the right candidates and 'headhunt' people. This involves interviewing them all and then setting up interviews with my clients (the companies I recruit for) and then (hopefully) placing them into the job. I wasn't actually looking for this job, I was just looking for a sales job. But this came about and it's a sales job by working to targets to make a certain amount of money etc, I guess I have got to where I am now by working really hard, learning what I could, when I could. A lot of resilience needed for the job as I get a lot of rejection when cold calling and that but it's great fun when I place people into jobs, and plus I get commission for each person so that makes it a lot better too!
Hope that makes sense, can't explain it that easy in a message without writing an essay! Lol

Yes, I learn best by doing things which means actually working. I've also thought about doing an apprenticeship but i haven't looked really deep into it. (Plus i love working, doing things, keeping active. Yes I know it sounds a bit crazy, but i actually find working quite fun. I work in a hotel so it's always kind of busy and there's always something to do.)

Yes i understood what you meant, don't worry :joy: but between all of that do you like your job? Would you ever change career if you could? And if you did what would it be?

Yeah exactly it seems like an apprenticeship could be a good idea, perhaps you should probably look into it? There's loads of different ones so could be a good idea! Ah that's not crazy I like working too! Haha, oh cool what's your job there? 

Okay good! Yeah I definitely like my job, there's times where it's stressful and can be hard work, but it's actually a career and teaching me a lot and that's really valuable so I really appreciate that I have the opportunity to have a job like this. I'm not quite sure what I would want to do if I changed jobs, I would probably stay in a sales role, like a client facing role, as I now have a lot of experience in that area, but apart from that I haven't got many ideas what I could get into, as I've always wanted to be in a role like this really! 

Do you think you would ever enjoy having a job like recruitment?
